title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: Output 1.5: Child protection system effectively prevents and responds to violence against children and children in conflict with the law, and for prevention of drug abuse., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 1: Inclusive equitable and quality social services for children (and adolescents), especially the disadvantaged and vulnerable are improved by 2020

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5: Child protection system effectively prevents and responds to violence against children and children in conflict with the law, and for prevention of drug abuse.

description.narrative: Child Rights Protection Act and Juvenile Justice Act was ratified by president on the World Children's Day . These acts represent a major transformation of children rights and justice for children in the Maldives. The ratification of these acts on the 30th Anniversary of the CRC culminates with success over 10 years of UNICEF advocacy and persistent technical engagement with the Attorney General Office and the Parliament. Today, the child is defined as any person under the age of 18, the minimum age of criminal responsibility is set at 15 years, and no child is subject to capital punishment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2019
